patient_info: Abnormal vagina morphology,Abnormal mandible morphology,Hearing impairment,Conjunctivitis,Abnormality of the breast,Cafe-au-lait spot,Skin rash,Gait disturbance,Bone pain,Fractures of the long bones,Elevated circulating alkaline phosphatase concentration,Abnormal femoral neck morphology,Large cafe-au-lait macules with irregular margins,Accelerated skeletal maturation,Precocious puberty in females,Fibrous dysplasia of the bones,Increased serum estradiol,Decreased circulating follicle stimulating hormone concentration,Decreased circulating luteinizing hormone level,Ear pain,Hip pain,Increased size of nasopharyngeal adenoids,Metrorrhagia
golden_diagnosis: McCune-Albright 综合征/McCune-Albright syndrome; MAS/McCune-Albright syndrome/McCune-Albright syndrome, somatic, mosaic,McCune-Albright 综合征/McCune-Albright syndrome; MAS/McCune-Albright syndrome/McCune-Albright syndrome, somatic, mosaic,McCune-Albright 综合征/McCune-Albright syndrome; MAS/McCune-Albright syndrome/McCune-Albright syndrome, somatic, mosaic
predict_diagnosis:
1. McCune-Albright syndrome; MAS/McCune-Albright syndrome/McCune-Albright syndrome, somatic, mosaic
2. Neurometabolic disorders (e.g., mucopolysaccharidoses, gangliosidoses, sphingolipidoses, and glycosylation disorders)
3. Bone dysplasias (e.g., osteogenesis imperfecta, achondroplasia, and hypochondroplasia)
4. Connective tissue disorders (e.g., Ehlers-Danlos syndrome, Marfan syndrome, and osteogenesis imperfecta)
5. Genetic disorders affecting the nervous system (e.g., torsades de pointes, long QT syndrome, and cerebral cavernous malformations)
6. Genetic disorders affecting the endocrine system (e.g., congenital adrenal hyperplasia, Turner syndrome, and hypothyroidism)
7. Genetic disorders affecting the musculoskeletal system (e.g., muscular dystrophy, myotonic dystrophy, and limb-girdle muscular dystrophy)
8. Genetic disorders affecting the eye (e.g., retinitis pigmentosa, Leber congenital amaurosis, and Stargardt disease)
9. Genetic disorders affecting the skin (e.g., epidermolysis bullosa, junctional epidermolysis bullosa, and pachyonychia congenita)
10. Genetic disorders affecting the female reproductive system (e.g., Turner syndrome, mullerian duct anomalies, and Mayer-Rokitansky-Küster-Hauser syndrome)

Please provide a detailed explanation for each diagnosis, including the underlying genetic mutation or defect, clinical features, and any relevant laboratory or imaging findings.
